oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with Adam G. Adams, III, 1976 October 04, excerpt 04
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville and Florida businessman and real estate broker Adam G. Adams, III, conducted on 4 October 1976 by Ann Wells as part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Tennessee Centennial Project. Adams discusses growing up with his six brothers and how they accommodated sleeping arrangements for nine people. Adams died twenty-two days after this interview was conducted. The complete interview is available in the Special Collections Division.
